1.brief: an apostle, a messenger, an envoy, a delegate
1.long: a messenger, envoy, delegate, one commissioned by another to represent him in some way, especially a man sent out by Jesus Christ Himself to preach the Gospel; an apostle.
Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.

chosen out, elect, choice, select, sometimes as subst: of those chosen out by God for the rendering of special service to Him (of the Hebrew race, particular Hebrews, the Messiah, and the Christians).

1.brief: residing in a strange country, a stranger
1.long: residing in a strange country; subst: a stranger, sojourner.
lit: scattering abroad of seed by the sower, hence: dispersion, used especially of the Jews who had migrated and were scattered over the ancient world.
Pontus, a Roman province in the north of Asia Minor, bordering on the Black Sea, governed along with Bithynia.

Galatia, a large Roman province in central Asia Minor, comprising the districts of Paphlagonia, Pontus Galaticus, Galatia (in the narrower sense, which some still think is intended in the NT), Phrygia Galatica, Lycaonia Galatica, Pisidia and Isaurica.
Cappadocia, a large Roman province in the central eastern part of Asia Minor.

1.brief: roughly the western third of Asia Minor
1.long: the Roman province of Asia, roughly the western third of Asia Minor.
Bithynia, a Roman province, north-west of Asia Minor and south-west of the Black Sea.
